svcproc.title: BRAKE LINING
svcproc.para: To assist in a visual inspection of brake linings, dust shields employ two inspection holes. This allows the linings to be inspected without removing the dust shields.
For visual inspection of brake lining wear, the linings can be grooved on the side, or chamfered on the 4 inner corners, as shown in Figure 17.

This makes it easier to determine how much the lining has been worn, and when the vehicle should be scheduled for relining. When the lining has worn down to the groove, or when the chamfered corners have been worn away, replacement is necessary. A visual check may be made through the inspection holes in the dust shields.

step1.para: If reline period is 100,000 miles (160,000 km) or greater, disassemble and overhaul all brake actuating components. Do not use combination linings.
If reline period is appreciably less than 100,000 miles (160,000 km):

step2.para: Remove adjusting plungers and related parts.
Clean and regrease adjusting bolt and sleeve (or plunger). Refer to LUBRICATE.
Check internal condition: if satisfactory, reassemble; if unsatisfactory, overhaul entire actuating system.
